context: By 2020, Broadcom had transformed into a hybrid semiconductor and enterprise software company through major acquisitions. The company had acquired CA Technologies (2018) and Symantec's Enterprise Security business (2019), diversifying beyond pure semiconductors. Broadcom was the sixth-largest semiconductor company globally with over $30 billion in annual revenue. In semiconductors, it dominated networking chips for data centers and wireless communications. In software, it competed in virtualization, infrastructure, and security software for large enterprises, financial institutions, and governments.
